newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 9.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 9.

text.p: * Value Health Inc said it plans to spin off its ValueRx prescription benefit unit. Value Health also said it agreed to buy MedView Services Inc, the workers' compensation managed care unit of Beverly Enterprises, for $87.5 million. Value Health closed at 18-1/8 and Beverly closed at 10-3/4.
* Intel Corp rose 1-3/8 to 103 in after-hours trading on Tuesday following the release of improved September book-to-bill figures. Micron Technology Inc gained 7/8 to 32-3/8 in after-hours activity.
* Starwood Capital Group said it raised its offer for California Jockey to $22 per share from $20. California Jockey closed at 20-7/8.
* ENlighten Software Solutions said it expects a third quarter loss of $0.09 to $0.10 per share. ENlighten closed at 5-7/8.

* Thompson PBE Inc said it trimmed its fourth quarter outlook because of soft sales and now expects to earn $0.14 to $0.15 per share before charges. The company said it expects to be profitable after charges. Shares closed at 9-3/8.
